Interface Graph<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdjazenzlisteGraph, AdjazenzmatrixGraph

    public interface Graph<T>
    Interface for a Graph
    Version:
    1.0 - 07.11.2016
    Author:
    Moritz HÃ¶wer

    • Method Detail

      • insertNode

        void insertNode(Node<T> node)
        Inserts a new Node into the Graph
        Parameters:
        node - the node to insert

      • removeNode

        void removeNode(Node<T> node)
        Removes a Node from the Graph
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to remove

      • insertConnection

        void insertConnection(Node<T> start,
                      Node<T> end,
                      int weight)
        Inserts a new connection into the Graph. start and end Nodes must be part of the Graph and weight must be positive or zero
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the connection
        end - the end of the connection
        weight - the weight of the connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start or end are not part of the Graph, or if weight is negative

      • removeConnection

        void removeConnection(Node<T> start,
                      Node<T> end)
        Removes a connection from the Graph. errors are silently ignored
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the connection
        end - the end of the connection

      • getConnectionsFrom

        java.util.Set<Connection<T>> getConnectionsFrom(Node<T> node)
        Retrieves a Set of all connections to the neighbours of the specified Node
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to check
        Returns:
        a Set of the neighbours of the Node

      • getAllNodes

        java.util.Set<Node<T>> getAllNodes()
        Retrieves a Set of all the Nodes in the Graph
        Returns:
        all the Nodes in the Graph
